results.title: Confessions of a Train Spotter
results.brief_description: Michael Palin fulfils his dream as a childhood train spotter and travels the length of Britain by train - from Euston to the Kyle of Lochalsh - on a fascinating journey of history and rediscovery. Rated: G

results.title: Conditioning the young athlete (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Introduces the coach to the basic principles involved in training young athletes for competition. A training program should put together the appropriate combination of energy and muscle fitness according to the requirements of the sport.

results.title: Concrete city
results.creator_credit: Fabio Cavadini, Mandy King and Frontyard Films
results.brief_description: This thought-provoking film about a small community of working class people who live in the old wharfside Sydney suburb of Pyrmont, brings into question the notion of coummunity participation in major urban development schemes. The development, in this case, involves nothing less than the total destruction of a community and of valuable heritage sites, for the construction of a casino and a whole range of high rise commercial development. The community is “consulted” and “involved”, yet their own suggestions as to how best develop the area are largely ignored.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fabio Cavadini, Mandy King and Frontyard Films

results.title: Concerto grosso modo
results.creator_credit: Francois Aubry, Yves Leduc and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film about the magic of music. A group of musicians plays on stage. Suddenly, the audience is drawn through a cello into a mysterious world where musical notes assume human qualities. They discover how music is made. A combination of live action and cel animation emphasizes the transition from reality to fantasy. The film works as entertainment and as a teaching tool for children and adults. Film without words.

results.title: Compelling images (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Advertising images have to be in sympathy with the brand they are selling otherwise the product may be rejected. This program shows how a new commercial was made to update the image of Levi jeans for the ‘80s.

results.title: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology
results.creator_credit: David Tiley, Penny Robins, Video Projects and Commonwealth Schools Commission (Australia)

video_links.name: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology

results.brief_description: Looks at the use of computers as word-processors and databases in the teaching of history. Programs such as database, newsroom and open database are shown being used. The program also highlights some of the problems, and some of the advantages of using this approach to the teaching of history.

results.title: Computer games
results.brief_description: ‘Computer games’ is a light-hearted drama about clashing personalities and computer crime in the corporate world. The director’s intention was to create a good, fun, entertaining film with a number of twists and surprises. The setting of the film is a high technology office environment where employee Raymond Edwards (David Whiteley) has one basic problem. For many years he has endured the company of Tony Simmons, a naive and aggravating workmate. Raymond’s experience is one to which many people can relate. He is frustrated by the constant annoying presence of a workmate who has followed him like a shadow through his career. Desperate to prevent Tony being considered for a promotion, Raymond frames him for embezzlement.

results.title: Computer Graphics Special
results.creator_credit: Steve Michelson, Geoffrey de Valois and Donna Cohen
results.brief_description: Journey to the unknown as this thoroughly entertaining program takes you on a behind the scenes journey into the exciting world of computer graphics and animation. Travel from inside the body to outer space; as the worlds of fantasy and reality explode in a colour and intensity never seen before.

results.title: Comput-her baby
results.creator_credit: Neal Chastain, Dave Goldson and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: A humorous but pointed satire on computer dating. Accompanied by ironically contrasting musical background, human voices reveal personal statistics for consumption by the computer. Compares cybernetic matching and old-fashioned computers, and questions the relationship between people and computers.
